panels.description: Used CPU from a total available of 100%.
panels.title: CPU Used

panels.description: Used CPU from a total available of 100%.
panels.title: CPU Individual Cores Used

panels.description:
Reads + Writes = Total.
- Critical:
  - If > 500 iops then there is a High Load.
panels.title: Disk IOPs, Reads, Writes

panels.description:
DISK seconds Read/ Write Latency.
- Critical:
  - Recommended performance value is < 10ms as avg value of the Avg Disk sec/Read,Write.
  - Critical value of the Avg Disk sec/Read,Write is > 50ms, should not exceed this value.
panels.title: DISK RW Latency

panels.description:
Filesystem used file nodes.
> If is > 85% the is Critical.
panels.title: FILESYSTEM Inodes Used

panels.description:
Used FILE DESCRIPTORS from a total available of 100%.
- FILE DESCRIPTORS Threshold:
 >Critical: > 90% Used FILE DESCRIPTORS
panels.title: FILE DESCRIPTORS Used

panels.description:
Whether an error occurred while getting statistics for the given device.
> A value > 0 Means that there are some problems with that device.
panels.title: FILESYSTEM Device Error

panels.description:
- Valid operstate for interface.
  - UP = 1
  - DOWN = 0
panels.title: NETWORK INTERFACE State

panels.description:
IN/ OUT Traffic rate.
- Critical:
  - If IN/OUT traffic = 0% from a total of 100% possible on that interface there is Low Bandwidth or interface problem.
  - If IN/OUT traffic > 95% from a total of 100% possible on that interface there is High Bandwidth.

95% (0.95 x 1e+09 =0.95 x 1 x 10^9 = 0.884756 GB, Gigabytes) supposing that the interface is 1 GB.
panels.title: NETWORK IN/OUT Traffic

panels.description:
Network Packets for IN/OUT.
- Critical:
   - If  is = 0 for IN/OUT.
panels.title: NETWORK IN/OUT Packets

panels.description:
Network Drops.
- Critical:
   - If  is > 0 then are Drops on that interface (IN/OUT) and is not ok.
panels.title: NETWORK IN/OUT Drops

panels.description:
Network Errors on IN/OUT.
- Critical:
  - If Errors > 0 then there are some problems on that interface.
panels.title: NETWORK IN/OUT Errors

panels.description:
Processes used File Descriptors.
- Critical:
   - If > 85% then there is High Usage.
panels.title: PROCESSES FILE DESCRIPTORS Used

panels.description: Time offset in between local system and reference clock.
panels.title: NTP Offset in Seconds

panels.description: 0/1 based on if considered in sync
panels.title: NTP Sync Status

panels.description:
Bits of available entropy.
- Critical:
  - If < 500 there is a problem.
The following command will tell you the available entropy in your system:

$ cat /proc/sys/kernel/random/entropy_avail
The consensus is that numbers below 1000 will lead to processes blocking waiting for more entropy.
panels.title: ENTROPY
